pullRequest.body:
Adds a linter that detects calls to `simp` where the next line is at the same indentation level.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

- [x] depends on: #7497

- [x] depends on: #7795

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
I am noticing some examples of 
```
simp
rfl
```
Is this supposed to be ok?
Hmm, I thought you would write this in lean. Doing it in text seems brittle.

> Hmm, I thought you would write this in lean. Doing it in text seems brittle.

I guess you mean you thought I would write it in Lean rather than Python? 

Seems like all the current infrastructure for writing linters centers on `lint-style.py` though. Presumably there is some Lean tool for parsing lean ASTs that could be useful, but I am not familiar with it. Perhaps the maintainers should consider whether they want to accept further changes to this file or instead get someone to rewrite it all in Lean. I'm happy to close this PR if it's the latter.

Note: I have pushed an update to the lean toolchain because this PR was on a [buggy version](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/113488-general/topic/Potential.20data.20loss.20from.20.60lake.20clean.60.20with.204.2E2.2E0-rc2.2F3/near/397875701) of the toolchain. **WARNING**: checking out old commits of this PR using v4.2.0-rc2 or v4.2.0-rc3 can cause `lake clean` to delete your mathlib folder! If you need to do so, make sure to delete `lakefile.olean` manually before running any `lake` commands.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#7497~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#7580~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#7795~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Noticing now this `_eq_3`, which I think was previously disliked, so I'm removing that.
bors r+

Build failed:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8121321435/job/22199527996)
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by Ruben-VandeVelde.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8125731618/job/22208678753)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8125731618/job/22208678508)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8125731618/job/22208678676)

I imagine that this is a regular expression that matches lines consisting of "<whitespace>simp<line_break>".

Shouldn't the linter also catch "<whitespace>simp [some lemmas, possibly with line breaks]" that are non-terminal?
Good point.
Seems tricky to match multiple lines like this, since the loop goes line by line, but I'll at least try to match simp [ ... ] \n
Feel free to ignore this comment, but there are also a few non-terminal `simp ([...])? at ...`.  :speak_no_evil:
Wait is it considered nonterminal to `simp at`? I thought it was ok because you can never finish a proof by `simp at` anyway.
I would definitely think so: a change in the `simp` set could change what the targeted hypothesis reduces to, breaking the rest of the proof.

Ok I think this is a good idea to lint, but there are a lot more violations if so. I have fixed some of them, but some were harder/more ambiguous. I am putting this back to how it was and inserting a TODO in the linter script.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - style: add nonterminal simp checker
